trans-unit.source: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure Portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure Portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to administer HDInsight Service.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to administer HDInsight Service.

trans-unit.source: Create an HDInsight cluster, open the interactive JavaScript console, and open the Hadoop command console.
trans-unit.target: Create an HDInsight cluster, open the interactive JavaScript console, and open the Hadoop command console.

trans-unit.source: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Using the [Azure Portal][azure-portal], you can create Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight, change Hadoop user password, and enable Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) so you can access the Hadoop command console on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Using the [Azure Portal][azure-portal], you can create Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight, change Hadoop user password, and enable Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) so you can access the Hadoop command console on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The information in this article only applies to Window-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: The information in this article only applies to Window-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For information on managing Linux-based clusters, click the tab selector above.
trans-unit.target: For information on managing Linux-based clusters, click the tab selector above.

trans-unit.source: Click the tab selector for information on creating Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using other tools.
trans-unit.target: Click the tab selector for information on creating Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using other tools.

trans-unit.source: [Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal](hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal-v1.md)
trans-unit.target: [Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal](hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal-v1.md)

trans-unit.source: **Prerequisites**
trans-unit.target: **Prerequisites**

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **Azure Storage account** - An HDInsight cluster uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Storage account** - An HDInsight cluster uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how Azure Blob storage provides a seamless experience with HDInsight clusters, see [Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-use-blob-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about how Azure Blob storage provides a seamless experience with HDInsight clusters, see [Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-use-blob-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see [How to Create a Storage Account](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see [How to Create a Storage Account](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md).

trans-unit.source: Open the Portal
trans-unit.target: Open the Portal

trans-unit.source: Sign in to [https://portal.azure.com](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to [https://portal.azure.com](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: After you open the portal, you can:
trans-unit.target: After you open the portal, you can:

trans-unit.source: Click **New** from the left menu to create a new cluster:
trans-unit.target: Click **New** from the left menu to create a new cluster:

trans-unit.source: ![new HDInsight cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-new-button.png)
trans-unit.target: ![new HDInsight cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-new-button.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **HDInsight Clusters** from the left menu.
trans-unit.target: Click **HDInsight Clusters** from the left menu.

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal HDInsight cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-hdinsight-button.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal HDInsight cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-hdinsight-button.png)

trans-unit.source: If **HDInsight** doesn't appear in the left menu, click **Browse**.
trans-unit.target: If **HDInsight** doesn't appear in the left menu, click **Browse**.

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal Browse cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-browse-button.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal Browse cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-browse-button.png)

trans-unit.source: Create clusters
trans-unit.target: Create clusters

trans-unit.source: For the creation instructions using the Portal, see [Create HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md#create-using-the-preview-portal).
trans-unit.target: For the creation instructions using the Portal, see [Create HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md#create-using-the-preview-portal).

trans-unit.source: HDInsight works with a wide range of Hadoop components.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight works with a wide range of Hadoop components.

trans-unit.source: For the list of the components that have been verified and supported, see [What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).
trans-unit.target: For the list of the components that have been verified and supported, see [What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).

trans-unit.source: You can customize HDInsight by using one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: You can customize HDInsight by using one of the following options:

trans-unit.source: Use Script Action to run custom scripts that can customize a cluster to either change cluster configuration or install custom components such as Giraph or Solr.
trans-unit.target: Use Script Action to run custom scripts that can customize a cluster to either change cluster configuration or install custom components such as Giraph or Solr.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the cluster customization parameters in the HDInsight .NET SDK or Azure PowerShell during cluster creation.
trans-unit.target: Use the cluster customization parameters in the HDInsight .NET SDK or Azure PowerShell during cluster creation.

trans-unit.source: These configuration changes are then preserved through the lifetime of the cluster and are not affected by cluster node reimages that Azure platform periodically performs for maintenance.
trans-unit.target: These configuration changes are then preserved through the lifetime of the cluster and are not affected by cluster node reimages that Azure platform periodically performs for maintenance.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the cluster customization parameters, see [Create HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the cluster customization parameters, see [Create HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: Some native Java components, like Mahout and Cascading, can be run on the cluster as JAR files.
trans-unit.target: Some native Java components, like Mahout and Cascading, can be run on the cluster as JAR files.

trans-unit.source: These JAR files can be distributed to Azure Blob storage, and submitted to HDInsight clusters through Hadoop job submission mechanisms.
trans-unit.target: These JAR files can be distributed to Azure Blob storage, and submitted to HDInsight clusters through Hadoop job submission mechanisms.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically](hdinsight-submit-hadoop-jobs-programmatically.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically](hdinsight-submit-hadoop-jobs-programmatically.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have issues deploying JAR files to HDInsight clusters or calling JAR files on HDInsight clusters, contact [Microsoft Support](https://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have issues deploying JAR files to HDInsight clusters or calling JAR files on HDInsight clusters, contact [Microsoft Support](https://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/).

trans-unit.source: Cascading is not supported by HDInsight, and is not eligible for Microsoft Support.
trans-unit.target: Cascading is not supported by HDInsight, and is not eligible for Microsoft Support.

trans-unit.source: For lists of supported components, see [What's new in the cluster versions provided by HDInsight?](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).
trans-unit.target: For lists of supported components, see [What's new in the cluster versions provided by HDInsight?](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).

trans-unit.source: Installation of custom software on the cluster by using Remote Desktop Connection is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Installation of custom software on the cluster by using Remote Desktop Connection is not supported.

trans-unit.source: You should avoid storing any files on the drives of the head node, as they will be lost if you need to re-create the clusters.
trans-unit.target: You should avoid storing any files on the drives of the head node, as they will be lost if you need to re-create the clusters.

trans-unit.source: We recommend storing files on Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: We recommend storing files on Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Blob storage is persistent.
trans-unit.target: Blob storage is persistent.

trans-unit.source: List and show clusters
trans-unit.target: List and show clusters

trans-unit.source: Sign in to [https://portal.azure.com](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to [https://portal.azure.com](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: Click **HDInsight Clusters** from the left menu:
trans-unit.target: Click **HDInsight Clusters** from the left menu:

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal HDInsight cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-hdinsight-button.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal HDInsight cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-hdinsight-button.png)

trans-unit.source: If **HDInsight** doesn't appear in the left menu, click **Browse**:
trans-unit.target: If **HDInsight** doesn't appear in the left menu, click **Browse**:

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal Browse cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-browse-button.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal Browse cluster buttom](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/azure-portal-browse-button.png)

trans-unit.source: You shall see a list of clusters if there are any:
trans-unit.target: You shall see a list of clusters if there are any:

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal cluster list](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-list-clusters.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal cluster list](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-list-clusters.png)

trans-unit.source: Use **Filter items** and "Subscription" to narrow down the list.
trans-unit.target: Use **Filter items** and "Subscription" to narrow down the list.

trans-unit.source: Double-click a cluster from the list to show the details.
trans-unit.target: Double-click a cluster from the list to show the details.

trans-unit.source: **Menu and essentials**:
trans-unit.target: **Menu and essentials**:

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal hdinsight cluster essentials](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-essentials.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal hdinsight cluster essentials](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-essentials.png)

trans-unit.source: To customize the memu, right-click anywhere on the menu, and then click **Customize**.
trans-unit.target: To customize the memu, right-click anywhere on the menu, and then click **Customize**.

trans-unit.source: **Settings** and **All Settings**: Displays the **Settings** blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Settings** and **All Settings**: Displays the **Settings** blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Dashboard**, **Cluster Dashboard** and **URL: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is Ambari Web for Linux-based clusters.
trans-unit.target: **Dashboard**, **Cluster Dashboard** and **URL: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is Ambari Web for Linux-based clusters.

trans-unit.source: **Remote Desktop**: Connect to the cluster using RDP.
trans-unit.target: **Remote Desktop**: Connect to the cluster using RDP.

trans-unit.source: **Scale Cluster**: Allows you to change the number of workder nodes for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Scale Cluster**: Allows you to change the number of workder nodes for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Delete**: Deletes the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Delete**: Deletes the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Quickstart (![cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-portal-linux/quickstart.png))**: Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: **Quickstart (![cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-portal-linux/quickstart.png))**: Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: **Users (![users icon](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-portal-linux/users.png))**: Allows you to set permissions for _portal management_ of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: **Users (![users icon](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-portal-linux/users.png))**: Allows you to set permissions for _portal management_ of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] This _only_ affects access and permissions to this cluster in the Azure preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] This _only_ affects access and permissions to this cluster in the Azure preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: - **Tags (![tag icon](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-portal-linux/tags.png))**: Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.
trans-unit.target: - **Tags (![tag icon](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-portal-linux/tags.png))**: Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may create a key named __project__, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may create a key named __project__, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.

trans-unit.source: - **Documentation**: Links to documentation for Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: - **Documentation**: Links to documentation for Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To manage the services provided by the HDInsight cluster, you must use Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To manage the services provided by the HDInsight cluster, you must use Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using Ambari, see [Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari](hdinsight-hadoop-manage-ambari.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using Ambari, see [Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari](hdinsight-hadoop-manage-ambari.md).

trans-unit.source: **Usage**:
trans-unit.target: **Usage**:

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal hdinsight cluster usage](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-portal-cluster-usage.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal hdinsight cluster usage](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-portal-cluster-usage.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal hdinsight cluster usage](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.cluster.settings.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal hdinsight cluster usage](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.cluster.settings.png)

trans-unit.source: **Properties**: View the cluster properties.
trans-unit.target: **Properties**: View the cluster properties.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster AAD Identity**:
trans-unit.target: **Cluster AAD Identity**:

trans-unit.source: **Azure Storage Keys**: View the default storage account and its key.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Storage Keys**: View the default storage account and its key.

trans-unit.source: The storage account is configuration during the cluster creation process.
trans-unit.target: The storage account is configuration during the cluster creation process.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster Login**: Change the cluster HTTP user name and password.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster Login**: Change the cluster HTTP user name and password.

trans-unit.source: **External Metastores**: View the Hive and Oozie metastores.
trans-unit.target: **External Metastores**: View the Hive and Oozie metastores.

trans-unit.source: The metastores can only be configured during the cluster creation process.
trans-unit.target: The metastores can only be configured during the cluster creation process.

trans-unit.source: **Scale Cluster**: Increase and decrease the number of cluster worker nodes.
trans-unit.target: **Scale Cluster**: Increase and decrease the number of cluster worker nodes.

trans-unit.source: **Remote Desktop**: Enable and disable remote desktop (RDP) access, and configure the RDP username.
trans-unit.target: **Remote Desktop**: Enable and disable remote desktop (RDP) access, and configure the RDP username.

trans-unit.source: The RDP user name must be different from the HTTP user name.
trans-unit.target: The RDP user name must be different from the HTTP user name.

trans-unit.source: **Partner of Record**:
trans-unit.target: **Partner of Record**:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This is a generic list of available settings; not all of them will be present for all cluster types.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This is a generic list of available settings; not all of them will be present for all cluster types.

trans-unit.source: Click **Properties**:
trans-unit.target: Click **Properties**:

trans-unit.source: The properties lists the following:
trans-unit.target: The properties lists the following:

trans-unit.source: **Hostname**: Cluster name.
trans-unit.target: **Hostname**: Cluster name.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster URL**.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster URL**.

trans-unit.source: **Status**: Include Aborted, Accepted, ClusterStorageProvisioned, AzureVMConfiguration, HDInsightConfiguration, Operational, Running, Error, Deleting, Deleted, Timedout, DeleteQueued, DeleteTimedout, DeleteError, PatchQueued, CertRolloverQueued, ResizeQueued, ClusterCustomization
trans-unit.target: **Status**: Include Aborted, Accepted, ClusterStorageProvisioned, AzureVMConfiguration, HDInsightConfiguration, Operational, Running, Error, Deleting, Deleted, Timedout, DeleteQueued, DeleteTimedout, DeleteError, PatchQueued, CertRolloverQueued, ResizeQueued, ClusterCustomization

trans-unit.source: **Region**: Azure location.
trans-unit.target: **Region**: Azure location.

trans-unit.source: For a list of supported Azure locations, see the **Region** dropdown list box on [HDInsight pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: For a list of supported Azure locations, see the **Region** dropdown list box on [HDInsight pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **Data created**.
trans-unit.target: **Data created**.

trans-unit.source: **Operating system**: Either **Windows** or **Linux**.
trans-unit.target: **Operating system**: Either **Windows** or **Linux**.

trans-unit.source: **Type**: Hadoop, HBase, Storm, Spark.
trans-unit.target: **Type**: Hadoop, HBase, Storm, Spark.

trans-unit.source: **Version**.
trans-unit.target: **Version**.

trans-unit.source: See [HDInsight versions](hdinsight-component-versioning.md)
trans-unit.target: See [HDInsight versions](hdinsight-component-versioning.md)

trans-unit.source: **Subscriotion**: Subscription name.
trans-unit.target: **Subscriotion**: Subscription name.

trans-unit.source: **Subscrition ID**.
trans-unit.target: **Subscrition ID**.

trans-unit.source: **Primary data source**.
trans-unit.target: **Primary data source**.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Blob storage account used as the default Hadoop file system.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Blob storage account used as the default Hadoop file system.

trans-unit.source: **Worker nodes pricing tier**.
trans-unit.target: **Worker nodes pricing tier**.

trans-unit.source: **Head node pricing tier**.
trans-unit.target: **Head node pricing tier**.

trans-unit.source: Delete clusters
trans-unit.target: Delete clusters

trans-unit.source: Delete a cluster will not delete the default storange account or any linked storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: Delete a cluster will not delete the default storange account or any linked storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: You can re-create the cluster by using the same storage accounts and the same metastores.
trans-unit.target: You can re-create the cluster by using the same storage accounts and the same metastores.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click **Delete** from the top menu, and then follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: Click **Delete** from the top menu, and then follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: See also [Pause/shut down clusters](#pauseshut-down-clusters).
trans-unit.target: See also [Pause/shut down clusters](#pauseshut-down-clusters).

trans-unit.source: Scale clusters
trans-unit.target: Scale clusters

trans-unit.source: The cluster scaling feature allows you to change the number of worker nodes used by a cluster that is running in Azure HDInsight without having to re-create the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The cluster scaling feature allows you to change the number of worker nodes used by a cluster that is running in Azure HDInsight without having to re-create the cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Only clusters with HDInsight version 3.1.3 or higher are supported.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Only clusters with HDInsight version 3.1.3 or higher are supported.

trans-unit.source: If you are unsure of the version of your cluster, you can check the Properties page.
trans-unit.target: If you are unsure of the version of your cluster, you can check the Properties page.

trans-unit.source: See [List and show clusters](hdinsight-adminster-use-management-portal/#list-and-show-clusters).
trans-unit.target: See [List and show clusters](hdinsight-adminster-use-management-portal/#list-and-show-clusters).

trans-unit.source: The impact of changing the number of data nodes for each type of cluster supported by HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: The impact of changing the number of data nodes for each type of cluster supported by HDInsight:

trans-unit.source: Hadoop
trans-unit.target: Hadoop

trans-unit.source: You can seamlessly increase the number of worker nodes in a Hadoop cluster that is running without impacting any pending or running jobs.
trans-unit.target: You can seamlessly increase the number of worker nodes in a Hadoop cluster that is running without impacting any pending or running jobs.

trans-unit.source: New jobs can also be submitted while the operation is in progress.
trans-unit.target: New jobs can also be submitted while the operation is in progress.

trans-unit.source: Failures in a scaling operation are gracefully handled so that the cluster is always left in a functional state.
trans-unit.target: Failures in a scaling operation are gracefully handled so that the cluster is always left in a functional state.

trans-unit.source: When a Hadoop cluster is scaled down by reducing the number of data nodes, some of the services in the cluster are restarted.
trans-unit.target: When a Hadoop cluster is scaled down by reducing the number of data nodes, some of the services in the cluster are restarted.

trans-unit.source: This causes all running and pending jobs to fail at the completion of the scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: This causes all running and pending jobs to fail at the completion of the scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: You can, however, resubmit the jobs once the operation is complete.
trans-unit.target: You can, however, resubmit the jobs once the operation is complete.

trans-unit.source: HBase
trans-unit.target: HBase

trans-unit.source: You can seamlessly add or remove nodes to your HBase cluster while it is running.
trans-unit.target: You can seamlessly add or remove nodes to your HBase cluster while it is running.

trans-unit.source: Regional Servers are automatically balanced within a few minutes of completing the scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: Regional Servers are automatically balanced within a few minutes of completing the scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: However, you can also manually balance the regional servers by logging into the headnode of cluster and running the following commands from a command prompt window:
trans-unit.target: However, you can also manually balance the regional servers by logging into the headnode of cluster and running the following commands from a command prompt window:

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the HBase shell, see []
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the HBase shell, see []

trans-unit.source: Storm
trans-unit.target: Storm

trans-unit.source: You can seamlessly add or remove data nodes to your Storm cluster while it is running.
trans-unit.target: You can seamlessly add or remove data nodes to your Storm cluster while it is running.

trans-unit.source: But after a successful completion of the scaling operation, you will need to rebalance the topology.
trans-unit.target: But after a successful completion of the scaling operation, you will need to rebalance the topology.

trans-unit.source: Rebalancing can be accomplished in two ways:
trans-unit.target: Rebalancing can be accomplished in two ways:

trans-unit.source: Storm web UI
trans-unit.target: Storm web UI

trans-unit.source: Command-line interface (CLI) tool
trans-unit.target: Command-line interface (CLI) tool

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the [Apache Storm documentation](http://storm.apache.org/documentation/Understanding-the-parallelism-of-a-Storm-topology.html) for more details.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the [Apache Storm documentation](http://storm.apache.org/documentation/Understanding-the-parallelism-of-a-Storm-topology.html) for more details.

trans-unit.source: The Storm web UI is available on the HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: The Storm web UI is available on the HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight storm scale rebalance](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.scale.cluster.storm.rebalance.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight storm scale rebalance](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.scale.cluster.storm.rebalance.png)

trans-unit.source: Here is an example how to use the CLI command to rebalance the Storm topology:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example how to use the CLI command to rebalance the Storm topology:

trans-unit.source: **To scale clusters**
trans-unit.target: **To scale clusters**

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Scale Cluster**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Scale Cluster**.

trans-unit.source: Enter **Number of Worker nodes**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **Number of Worker nodes**.

trans-unit.source: The limit on the number of cluster node varies among Azure subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: The limit on the number of cluster node varies among Azure subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: You can contact billing support to increase the limit.
trans-unit.target: You can contact billing support to increase the limit.

trans-unit.source: The cost information will reflect the changes you have made to the number of nodes.
trans-unit.target: The cost information will reflect the changes you have made to the number of nodes.

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight hadoop hbase storm spark scale](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.scale.cluster.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight hadoop hbase storm spark scale](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.scale.cluster.png)

trans-unit.source: Pause/shut down clusters
trans-unit.target: Pause/shut down clusters

trans-unit.source: Most of Hadoop jobs are batch jobs that are only ran occasionally.
trans-unit.target: Most of Hadoop jobs are batch jobs that are only ran occasionally.

trans-unit.source: For most Hadoop clusters, there are large periods of time that the cluster is not being used for processing.
trans-unit.target: For most Hadoop clusters, there are large periods of time that the cluster is not being used for processing.

trans-unit.source: With HDInsight, your data is stored in Azure Storage, so you can safely delete a cluster when it is not in use.
trans-unit.target: With HDInsight, your data is stored in Azure Storage, so you can safely delete a cluster when it is not in use.

trans-unit.source: You are also charged for an HDInsight cluster, even when it is not in use.
trans-unit.target: You are also charged for an HDInsight cluster, even when it is not in use.

trans-unit.source: Since the charges for the cluster are many times more than the charges for storage, it makes economic sense to delete clusters when they are not in use.
trans-unit.target: Since the charges for the cluster are many times more than the charges for storage, it makes economic sense to delete clusters when they are not in use.

trans-unit.source: There are many ways you can program the process:
trans-unit.target: There are many ways you can program the process:

trans-unit.source: User Azure Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: User Azure Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure HDInsight Linked Service](../data-factory/data-factory-compute-linked-services.md/#azure-hdinsight-linked-service) and [Transform and analyze using Azure Data Factory](../data-factory/data-factory-data-transformation-activities.md) for on-demand and self-defined HDInsight linked services.
trans-unit.target: See [Azure HDInsight Linked Service](../data-factory/data-factory-compute-linked-services.md/#azure-hdinsight-linked-service) and [Transform and analyze using Azure Data Factory](../data-factory/data-factory-data-transformation-activities.md) for on-demand and self-defined HDInsight linked services.

trans-unit.source: Use Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See [Analyze flight delay data](hdinsight-analyze-flight-delay-data.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Analyze flight delay data](hdinsight-analyze-flight-delay-data.md).

trans-unit.source: Use Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage HDInsight clusters using Azure CLI](hdinsight-administer-use-command-line.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage HDInsight clusters using Azure CLI](hdinsight-administer-use-command-line.md).

trans-unit.source: Use HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Use HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: See [Submit Hadoop jobs](hdinsight-submit-hadoop-jobs-programmatically.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Submit Hadoop jobs](hdinsight-submit-hadoop-jobs-programmatically.md).

trans-unit.source: For the pricing information, see [HDInsight pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: For the pricing information, see [HDInsight pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: To delete a cluster from the Portal, see [Delete clusters](#delete-clusters)
trans-unit.target: To delete a cluster from the Portal, see [Delete clusters](#delete-clusters)

trans-unit.source: Change cluster username
trans-unit.target: Change cluster username

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster can have two user accounts.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster can have two user accounts.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight cluster user account is created during the creation process.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight cluster user account is created during the creation process.

trans-unit.source: You can also create an RDP user account for accessing the cluster via RDP.
trans-unit.target: You can also create an RDP user account for accessing the cluster via RDP.

trans-unit.source: See [Enable remote desktop](#connect-to-hdinsight-clusters-by-using-rdp).
trans-unit.target: See [Enable remote desktop](#connect-to-hdinsight-clusters-by-using-rdp).

trans-unit.source: **To change the HDInsight cluster user name and password**
trans-unit.target: **To change the HDInsight cluster user name and password**

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Cluster Login**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Cluster Login**.

trans-unit.source: If **Cluster login** has been enabled, you must click **Disable**, and then click **Enable** before you can change the username and password..
trans-unit.target: If **Cluster login** has been enabled, you must click **Disable**, and then click **Enable** before you can change the username and password..

trans-unit.source: Change the **Cluster Login Name** and/or the **Cluster Login Password**, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Change the **Cluster Login Name** and/or the **Cluster Login Password**, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight change cluster user username password http user](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.change.username.password.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight change cluster user username password http user](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.change.username.password.png)

trans-unit.source: Grant/revoke access
trans-unit.target: Grant/revoke access

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters have the following HTTP web services (all of these services have RESTful endpoints):
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters have the following HTTP web services (all of these services have RESTful endpoints):

trans-unit.source: ODBC
trans-unit.target: ODBC

trans-unit.source: JDBC
trans-unit.target: JDBC

trans-unit.source: Ambari
trans-unit.target: Ambari

trans-unit.source: Oozie
trans-unit.target: Oozie

trans-unit.source: Templeton
trans-unit.target: Templeton

trans-unit.source: By default, these services are granted for access.
trans-unit.target: By default, these services are granted for access.

trans-unit.source: You can revoke/grant the access from the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can revoke/grant the access from the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] By granting/revoking the access, you will reset the cluster user name and password.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] By granting/revoking the access, you will reset the cluster user name and password.

trans-unit.source: **To grant/revoke HTTP web services access**
trans-unit.target: **To grant/revoke HTTP web services access**

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Cluster Login**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Cluster Login**.

trans-unit.source: If **Cluster login** has been enabled, you must click **Disable**, and then click **Enable** before you can change the username and password..
trans-unit.target: If **Cluster login** has been enabled, you must click **Disable**, and then click **Enable** before you can change the username and password..

trans-unit.source: For **Cluster Login Username** and **Cluster Login Password**, enter the new user name and password (respectively) for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: For **Cluster Login Username** and **Cluster Login Password**, enter the new user name and password (respectively) for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click **SAVE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **SAVE**.

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight grand remove http web service access](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.change.username.password.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight grand remove http web service access](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.change.username.password.png)

trans-unit.source: Find the default storage account
trans-unit.target: Find the default storage account

trans-unit.source: Each HDInsight cluster has a default storage account.
trans-unit.target: Each HDInsight cluster has a default storage account.

trans-unit.source: The default storage account and its keys for a cluster apears under **Settings**/**Properties**/**Azure Storage Keys**.
trans-unit.target: The default storage account and its keys for a cluster apears under **Settings**/**Properties**/**Azure Storage Keys**.

trans-unit.source: See [List and show clusters](#list-and-show-clusters).
trans-unit.target: See [List and show clusters](#list-and-show-clusters).

trans-unit.source: Find the resource group
trans-unit.target: Find the resource group

trans-unit.source: In the ARM mode, each HDInsight cluster is created with an Azure resource group.
trans-unit.target: In the ARM mode, each HDInsight cluster is created with an Azure resource group.

trans-unit.source: The Azure resource group that a cluster belongs to appears in:
trans-unit.target: The Azure resource group that a cluster belongs to appears in:

trans-unit.source: The cluster list has a **Resource Group** column.
trans-unit.target: The cluster list has a **Resource Group** column.

trans-unit.source: Cluster **Essential** tile.
trans-unit.target: Cluster **Essential** tile.

trans-unit.source: See [List and show clusters](#list-and-show-clusters).
trans-unit.target: See [List and show clusters](#list-and-show-clusters).

trans-unit.source: Open HDInsight Query console
trans-unit.target: Open HDInsight Query console

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Query console includes the following features:
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Query console includes the following features:

trans-unit.source: **Getting started gallery**: To use the gallery , see [Learn Hadoop by using the Azure HDInsight Getting Started Gallery](hdinsight-learn-hadoop-use-sample-gallery.md).
trans-unit.target: **Getting started gallery**: To use the gallery , see [Learn Hadoop by using the Azure HDInsight Getting Started Gallery](hdinsight-learn-hadoop-use-sample-gallery.md).

trans-unit.source: **Hive Editor**: A GUI web interface for submitting Hive jobs.
trans-unit.target: **Hive Editor**: A GUI web interface for submitting Hive jobs.

trans-unit.source: See [Run Hive queries using the Query Console](hdinsight-hadoop-use-hive-query-console.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Run Hive queries using the Query Console](hdinsight-hadoop-use-hive-query-console.md).

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight portal hive editor](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-hive-editor.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight portal hive editor](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-hive-editor.png)

trans-unit.source: **Job history**: Monitor Hadoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: **Job history**: Monitor Hadoop jobs.

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight portal job history](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-job-history.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight portal job history](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-job-history.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Query Name** to show the details including Job properties, **Job Query**, and **Job Output.
trans-unit.target: Click **Query Name** to show the details including Job properties, **Job Query**, and **Job Output.

trans-unit.source: You can also download both the query and the output to your workstation.
trans-unit.target: You can also download both the query and the output to your workstation.

trans-unit.source: **File Browser**: Browse the default storage account and the linked storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: **File Browser**: Browse the default storage account and the linked storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight portal file browser browse](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-file-browser.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight portal file browser browse](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-file-browser.png)

trans-unit.source: On the screenshot, the **<Account>** type indicates the item is an Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: On the screenshot, the **<Account>** type indicates the item is an Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Click the account name to browse the files.
trans-unit.target: Click the account name to browse the files.

trans-unit.source: **Hadoop UI**.
trans-unit.target: **Hadoop UI**.

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight portal Hadoop UI](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-hadoop-ui.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight portal Hadoop UI](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-hadoop-ui.png)

trans-unit.source: From **Hadoop UI*, you can browse files, and check logs.
trans-unit.target: From **Hadoop UI*, you can browse files, and check logs.

trans-unit.source: **Yarn UI**.
trans-unit.target: **Yarn UI**.

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight portal YARN UI](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-yarn-ui.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight portal YARN UI](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight-yarn-ui.png)

trans-unit.source: Run Hive queries
trans-unit.target: Run Hive queries

trans-unit.source: To ran Hive jobs from the Portal, click **Hive Editor** in the HDInsight Query console.
trans-unit.target: To ran Hive jobs from the Portal, click **Hive Editor** in the HDInsight Query console.

trans-unit.source: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).
trans-unit.target: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).

trans-unit.source: Monitor jobs
trans-unit.target: Monitor jobs

trans-unit.source: To monitor jobs from the Portal, click **Job History** in the HDInsight Query console.
trans-unit.target: To monitor jobs from the Portal, click **Job History** in the HDInsight Query console.

trans-unit.source: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).
trans-unit.target: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).

trans-unit.source: Browse files
trans-unit.target: Browse files

trans-unit.source: To browse files stored in the default storage account and the linked storage accounts, click **File Browser** in the HDInsight Query console.
trans-unit.target: To browse files stored in the default storage account and the linked storage accounts, click **File Browser** in the HDInsight Query console.

trans-unit.source: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).
trans-unit.target: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).

trans-unit.source: You can also use the **Browse the file system** utility from the **Hadoop UI** in the HDInsight console.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the **Browse the file system** utility from the **Hadoop UI** in the HDInsight console.

trans-unit.source: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).
trans-unit.target: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).

trans-unit.source: Monitor cluster usage
trans-unit.target: Monitor cluster usage

trans-unit.source: The __Usage__ section of the HDInsight cluster blade dislays information about the number of cores available to your subscription for use with HDInsight, as well as the number of cores allocated to this cluster and how they are allocated for the nodes within this cluster.
trans-unit.target: The __Usage__ section of the HDInsight cluster blade dislays information about the number of cores available to your subscription for use with HDInsight, as well as the number of cores allocated to this cluster and how they are allocated for the nodes within this cluster.

trans-unit.source: See [List and show clusters](#list-and-show-clusters).
trans-unit.target: See [List and show clusters](#list-and-show-clusters).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To monitor the services provided by the HDInsight cluster, you must use Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To monitor the services provided by the HDInsight cluster, you must use Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using Ambari, see [Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari](hdinsight-hadoop-manage-ambari.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information on using Ambari, see [Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari](hdinsight-hadoop-manage-ambari.md)

trans-unit.source: Open Hadoop UI
trans-unit.target: Open Hadoop UI

trans-unit.source: To monitor the cluster, browse the file system, and check logs, click **Hadoop UI** in the HDInsight Query console.
trans-unit.target: To monitor the cluster, browse the file system, and check logs, click **Hadoop UI** in the HDInsight Query console.

trans-unit.source: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).
trans-unit.target: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).

trans-unit.source: Open Yarn UI
trans-unit.target: Open Yarn UI

trans-unit.source: To use Yarn user interface, click **Yarn UI** in the HDInsight Query console.
trans-unit.target: To use Yarn user interface, click **Yarn UI** in the HDInsight Query console.

trans-unit.source: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).
trans-unit.target: See [Open HDInsight Query console](#open-hdinsight-query-console).

trans-unit.source: Connect to clusters using RDP
trans-unit.target: Connect to clusters using RDP

trans-unit.source: The credentials for the cluster that you provided at its creation give access to the services on the cluster, but not to the cluster itself through Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: The credentials for the cluster that you provided at its creation give access to the services on the cluster, but not to the cluster itself through Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: You can turn on Remote Desktop access when you provision a cluster or after a cluster is provisioned.
trans-unit.target: You can turn on Remote Desktop access when you provision a cluster or after a cluster is provisioned.

trans-unit.source: For the instructions about enabling Remote Desktop at creation, see [Create HDInsight cluster](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For the instructions about enabling Remote Desktop at creation, see [Create HDInsight cluster](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: **To enable Remote Desktop**
trans-unit.target: **To enable Remote Desktop**

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Remote Desktop**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Remote Desktop**.

trans-unit.source: Enter **Expires On**, **Remote Desktop Username** and **Remote Desktop Password**, and then click **Enable**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **Expires On**, **Remote Desktop Username** and **Remote Desktop Password**, and then click **Enable**.

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight enable disable configure remote desktop](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.remote.desktop.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight enable disable configure remote desktop](./media/hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal/hdinsight.portal.remote.desktop.png)

trans-unit.source: The default valus for Expires On is a week.
trans-unit.target: The default valus for Expires On is a week.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also use the HDInsight .NET SDK to enable Remote Desktop on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also use the HDInsight .NET SDK to enable Remote Desktop on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the **EnableRdp** method on the HDInsight client object in the following manner: **client.EnableRdp(clustername, location, "rdpuser", "rdppassword", DateTime.Now.AddDays(6))**.
trans-unit.target: Use the **EnableRdp** method on the HDInsight client object in the following manner: **client.EnableRdp(clustername, location, "rdpuser", "rdppassword", DateTime.Now.AddDays(6))**.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, to disable Remote Desktop on the cluster, you can use **client.DisableRdp(clustername, location)**.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, to disable Remote Desktop on the cluster, you can use **client.DisableRdp(clustername, location)**.

trans-unit.source: For more information on these methods, see [HDInsight .NET SDK Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529017).
trans-unit.target: For more information on these methods, see [HDInsight .NET SDK Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529017).

trans-unit.source: This is applicable only for HDInsight clusters running on Windows.
trans-unit.target: This is applicable only for HDInsight clusters running on Windows.

trans-unit.source: **To connect to a cluster by using RDP**
trans-unit.target: **To connect to a cluster by using RDP**

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Portal][azure-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse All** from the left menu, click **HDInsight Clusters**, click your cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Remote Desktop**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** from the top menu, and then click **Remote Desktop**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Connect** and follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connect** and follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: If Connect is disable, you must enable it first.
trans-unit.target: If Connect is disable, you must enable it first.

trans-unit.source: Make sure using the Remote Desktop user username and password.
trans-unit.target: Make sure using the Remote Desktop user username and password.

trans-unit.source: You can't use the Cluster user credentials.
trans-unit.target: You can't use the Cluster user credentials.

trans-unit.source: Open Hadoop command line
trans-unit.target: Open Hadoop command line

trans-unit.source: To connect to the cluster by using Remote Desktop and use the Hadoop command line, you must first have enabled Remote Desktop access to the cluster as described in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the cluster by using Remote Desktop and use the Hadoop command line, you must first have enabled Remote Desktop access to the cluster as described in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: **To open a Hadoop command line**
trans-unit.target: **To open a Hadoop command line**

trans-unit.source: Connect to the cluster using Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the cluster using Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: From the desktop, double-click **Hadoop Command Line**.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop, double-click **Hadoop Command Line**.

trans-unit.source: ![HDI.HadoopCommandLine][image-hadoopcommandline]
trans-unit.target: ![HDI.HadoopCommandLine][image-hadoopcommandline]

trans-unit.source: For more information on Hadoop commands, see [Hadoop commands reference](http://hadoop.apache.org/docs/current/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CommandsManual.html).
trans-unit.target: For more information on Hadoop commands, see [Hadoop commands reference](http://hadoop.apache.org/docs/current/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/CommandsManual.html).

trans-unit.source: In the previous screenshot, the folder name has the Hadoop version number embedded.
trans-unit.target: In the previous screenshot, the folder name has the Hadoop version number embedded.

trans-unit.source: The version number can changed based on the version of the Hadoop components installed on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The version number can changed based on the version of the Hadoop components installed on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can use Hadoop environment variables to refer to those folders.
trans-unit.target: You can use Hadoop environment variables to refer to those folders.

trans-unit.target: For example:
